Monetary quantities adjusted for inflation `

Source: R/real_prices_indexer.R
real_prices_indexer.Rd

Monetary quantities adjusted for inflation `

Usage

real_prices_indexer(
  tbl,
  name,
  prices,
  variable,
  base_prices,
  .join = c("year", "month"),
  .keep = FALSE
)

Arguments

tbl

data.frame: Database connection or data.frame

name

character: variable name

prices

data.frame: Database connection or data.frame with the prices

variable

character: prices variable name

base_prices

numeric: indicates the base prices. See Details.

.join

character: name of the variable that joins the two data.frames

.keep

logical: indicates if the prices variables should be kept

Value

tbl a new data.frame with the variable in base prices

Details

The base_prices parameter can be a negative or positive integer. If it is a negative integer, the prices are adjusted backward by base_prices months. If it is a positive integer, the prices are adjusted forward by base_prices months. However, if the base_prices is 0, the prices are not adjusted. The base_prices parameter can be a two-element vector too. In this case, if the first element is a negative or positive integer lower than 1900, it will be interpreted as the number of years to move back or forward. If the first element is a positive integer greater than 1900, it will be interpreted as the year to use as the base. The sencond element needs to be a positive integer between 1 and 12, and is the month to use as the base.

Examples

if (FALSE) {
tbl <- data.frame(
  year = c(rep(2009, 12), rep(2010, 12), rep(2011, 12)),
  month = rep(1:12, 3),
  income = sample(100:500, 12 * 3, TRUE)
) %>%
dplyr::mutate(income2 = income)

cpi <- data.frame(
  year = c(rep(2008, 12), rep(2009, 12), rep(2010, 12), rep(2011, 12), rep(2012, 12)),
  month = rep(1:12, 5),
  cpi = 1:(12 * 5)
) %>%
  dplyr::mutate(
    cpi = cpi / cpi[year == 2010 & month == 12] * 100,
    cpi = round(cpi, 1)
  ) %>%
  vars_to_date(year = "year", month = "month")


# n months ago
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', -1, .keep = TRUE)

# n month later
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', 1, .keep = TRUE)

# same month, previous year (n = 12)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', -12, .keep = TRUE)

# same month, next year (n = 12)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', 12, .keep = TRUE)

# specific month, specific year (Jun 2009)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', c(2009, 6), .keep = TRUE)

# same year, specific month (June)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', c(0, 6), .keep = TRUE)

# n years ago, specific month (June previes year)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', c(-1, 6), .keep = TRUE)

# n years later, specific month (June next year)
real_prices_indexer(tbl, 'income2', cpi, 'cpi', c(1, 6), .keep = TRUE)
}
